projects.title: AWS Local Stack Partitioned Stream Processing
projects.description: This project implements a scalable, event-driven architecture for secure transaction signing using AWS LocalStack for local emulation. It ingests high-throughput unstructured data into Kinesis, persists raw inputs to S3 for replay, and routes records through an intermediate batching stream that triggers a Lambda function. The Lambda retrieves RSA private key ARNs from Aurora Serverless, signs the batched data, and stores signed payloads in a separate S3 bucket. It is built with CDK and Docker Compose, the system ensures reliable, exactly-once processing with optimized Lambda performance and modular RSA key management via AWS Secrets Manager.

projects.title: OpenGL 3D Modeling
projects.description:
This project demonstrates advanced OpenGL rendering techniques by implementing a real-time 3D scene with multiple camera perspectives.

It features three distinct geometric objects (a cube, a pyramid, and a prism) rendered with Phong-Blinn lighting and dynamic shading. The application showcases both a primary and a secondary camera, with the secondary camera's view displayed as a floating minimap overlay within the main window. The project includes custom framebuffer management, real-time object animation, and interactive window resizing, all built using modern OpenGL (Core Profile 3.3), GLFW, GLEW, and GLM for matrix and vector operations. This work highlights skills in C++, graphics programming, shader development, and real-time rendering pipeline management.

projects.title: React LLM
projects.description:
This project is a React-based single page application, styled using TailwindCSS, that allows users to explore and analyze character interactions in Project Gutenberg e-books. The application leverages a Language Learning Model (LLM) to process the text of e-books and visually represent character interactions through an interactive network graph.

The application is deployed on AWS using the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK), which automates the setup of AWS Lambda for backend processing and API Gateway for handling requests efficiently. This deployment strategy was chosen to take advantage of AWS's free tier, making it cost-effective and scalable.

projects.title: SQL Code Editor AI Agent
projects.description: This project is a tool that helps you create SQL queries using AI technology. It has a web interface that works like Cursor, making it easy to use. The system uses two different AI agents that work together: One agent talks with you to understand what you need. Another agent creates the actual SQL code.

projects.title: Dockerized Rust API using Tokio, Warp, Alloy, Foundry, and Grafana.
projects.description: This project is a Dockerized Rust API that leverages Tokio, Warp, Alloy, Foundry, and Grafana to interact with Ethereum nodes, providing balance queries and real-time monitoring. It integrates Anvil for local Ethereum development, OpenTelemetry for tracing, and Prometheus + Grafana for monitoring, making it a robust solution for blockchain-based applications. The API is built with Warp for high-performance async HTTP handling and supports structured logging, CORS, and OpenTelemetry tracing. With a simple Docker Compose setup, it allows seamless deployment and local development, ensuring a production-ready Ethereum API environment. 🚀🔗 #RustLang #Blockchain #Ethereum #Web3 #Observability.

projects.title: Risc Zero Rust app
projects.description: This project demonstrates a zero-knowledge proof system using RiscZero's zkVM. It compiles a guest program located in the ./methods/guest directory into an ELF binary, which is then executed by a host Rust application that also runs a Warp server. The server exposes endpoints to remotely trigger zkVM executions, allowing users to submit inputs, obtain the computed result along with a cryptographic proof of execution, and ultimately validate that proof on-chain. The entire process—from building the guest ELF to running the host server—is containerized using Docker, ensuring a reproducible and isolated environment for development and deployment.

projects.title: Upgradeable Solidity contract with access management.
projects.description: This project is a Solidity-based upgradeable smart contract system leveraging OpenZeppelin's upgradeable libraries to provide secure and flexible access control, signature verification, and contract management. It includes a Manager contract that handles role-based access control, pausability, upgradeability with state migration, and integration with an external Verifier contract for validating user signatures. Built with Foundry for testing and deployment, the system ensures security through strict role enforcement, robust error handling, and seamless upgrade mechanisms.

projects.title: Zero-Knowledge Contract Trust Mechanism
projects.description: This project, titled zk-trust, leverages Zero-Knowledge Proofs to enhance security in the DeFi ecosystem by verifying the attributes of ERC20 tokens before they are listed on platforms. By implementing a robust validation mechanism off-chain and confirming the authenticity on-chain via a Solidity smart contract, this system helps prevent fraud similar to the recent Ionic Money Hack, ensuring only legitimate tokens are used within the platform. Check out the full demonstration on GitHub to see how this innovative approach can safeguard investments and maintain trust in DeFi transactions.

projects.title: Ethereum local development with Anvil
projects.description: This project involved the development of an Ethereum-based application using the Web3.js library, which provided an engaging platform to interact with the blockchain. My role encompassed setting up a local development environment using Anvil, crafting scripts for sending transactions, and managing wallet balances. I successfully implemented functionality to handle cryptocurrency transactions dynamically by connecting to and interacting with a simulated Ethereum network. This experience enhanced my understanding of blockchain technology, Ethereum smart contracts, and the intricacies of transaction fee mechanisms, making it a valuable addition to my portfolio of cutting-edge technological competencies.

projects.title: AWS SageMaker CDK
projects.description: This project automates the deployment and management of multiple machine learning models using AWS services like SageMaker, Lambda, API Gateway, and EventBridge, ensuring seamless integration and scalable real-time inference.

projects.title: GCP Kubernetes
projects.description: This project involved setting up a Kubernetes cluster on Google Cloud Platform using Google Cloud Deployment Manager, automating the creation and management of GCP resources. I developed YAML and Jinja templates to efficiently deploy a multi-node Kubernetes cluster, enhancing scalability and availability. This initiative not only streamlined operations but also bolstered my expertise in cloud infrastructure and containerized environments, improving our team's development workflows.

projects.title: Visual Transformer (ViT) Classifier
projects.description: This project involves developing a deep learning model for classifying different types of apparel from images, such as T-shirts, trousers, pullovers, dresses, and more. Using a pre-trained Vision Transformer (ViT) as the base model, the project enhances it with additional layers to improve classification accuracy. The model is trained with techniques like data augmentation, batch normalization, and dropout to reduce overfitting and enhance performance. The training process includes handling class imbalances by sampling more instances of underrepresented classes, and the optimizer is fine-tuned to focus on these new layers. The goal is to create an accurate and robust model that can reliably identify various apparel categories in real-world applications.

projects.title: Hexagonal Architecture Spring Boot
projects.description: The projec utilizes Hexagonal Architecture in Java Spring Boot for e-commerce management with a React and Tailwind frontend. It features domain models, service interfaces, and custom exceptions to streamline operations, supported by comprehensive unit tests. Key functionalities, including user and product management, are demonstrated in interactive demos. The architecture promotes modularity and ease of maintenance, ensuring adaptability and scalability through well-defined web and database API adapters.

projects.title: LangChain Assistant
projects.description: This project represents a cutting-edge integration of LangChain and Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance the processing and comprehension of web search results, aiming to refine and reconstruct truncated information for improved clarity and user engagement. By leveraging advanced NLP techniques and custom tool development, we have successfully created an intelligent agent capable of consulting previous messages, conducting web searches, and presenting human-readable summaries without the common ellipsis truncation. This initiative not only showcases our commitment to innovation in AI-driven content refinement but also sets a new benchmark in the development of conversational agents, contributing significantly to the field of AI and offering tangible benefits to startups navigating the complexities of compliance in California.

projects.title: PySpark Docker
projects.description: This GitHub project demonstrates the innovative integration of PySpark within Docker containers, illustrating a scalable and efficient approach to processing large datasets in distributed computing environments. By leveraging Docker's virtualization capabilities alongside PySpark's powerful data processing engine, the project offers a blueprint for building and deploying scalable data analytics applications. It showcases how to encapsulate PySpark applications in Docker, ensuring consistency, portability, and ease of deployment across different environments.

projects.title: Cypress Tests
projects.description: This project showcases the integration of Cypress tests within a web development environment, emphasizing the crucial role of automated testing in building robust, error-free applications. By leveraging Cypress, an advanced end-to-end testing framework, the project aims to demonstrate best practices in test automation for both small and large-scale web projects.

projects.title: Microfrontends
projects.description: The project is centered on implementing a distributed frontend architecture for medium and large companies. It aims to enhance scalability and maintainability in web development by modularizing the frontend, thus facilitating smoother collaboration and more agile processes in complex, large-scale applications.

projects.title: AWS Django Ansible
projects.description: The project utilizes Ansible in a Docker container to implement a Django application. It provides flexibility by connecting to AWS EC2 instances, allowing seamless deployment and management of the application in both local and cloud environments.

projects.title: AWS Django Terraform
projects.description: The project aims to automate the deployment of a Django application using Terraform. It provisions an EC2 instance in a public subnet, installs necessary dependencies, and runs the application using Gunicorn.

projects.title: Apache Hive
projects.description: The project involved implementing a Hive server using Docker Compose, which reads and writes data to HDFS. The project also included using the Hive CLI, web interface, and Python PyHive library to interact with the Hive server. The goal was to demonstrate the versatility and ease of use of Hive and Docker Compose in setting up and managing a data processing pipeline with HDFS.

projects.title: Apache Kafka Project
projects.description: This project leverages Docker Compose to run an Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster, along with YARN and ZooKeeper, as well as Kafka. Python is used as both the producer and consumer to send and consume data into a Kafka topic, enabling distributed data processing and storage using a familiar language and ecosystem.

projects.title: Django Geospatial Data
projects.description: The project is a geospatial application that leverages GeoDjango and PostGIS to create and manage multiple points, lines, and polygons. It calculates distances between these objects and performs various operations using them to support geospatial analysis and visualization.

projects.title: Flexbox Project
projects.description: The project is a web development endeavor aimed at implementing flexbox, a powerful layout system used in modern CSS, with a focus on creating flexible and responsive designs. Through this project, developers will gain an understanding of the different properties and techniques that can be utilized to achieve custom layouts for their web pages. By leveraging flexbox, users will be able to create dynamic and adaptive interfaces that adjust to the size and orientation of various devices. This project aims to equip developers with the skills and knowledge necessary to create intuitive and visually appealing web layouts that can easily adapt to changing needs and trends.

projects.title: Hadoop Map Reduce
projects.description: The project involved setting up a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) using Docker and Docker Compose, followed by submitting a MapReduce job to the cluster. The web interface of the History Server was used to monitor the progress of the job.

projects.title: GPT Context Injection
projects.description: The project focuses on leveraging the powerful combination of the GPT API, Elasticsearch, and SpaCy to implement a specialized chatbot capable of context injection. The chatbot's primary objective is to ingest and analyze data from a specific WordPress blog, providing relevant and contextual responses to user queries.

projects.title: HBase Project
projects.description: The project is a Docker-based solution for storing unstructured data in HBase with HDFS as the underlying storage system. It includes a Python client for easy data storage and retrieval, making it an ideal solution for managing large volumes of data.

projects.title: Python Supervisord
projects.description: The project is a Python script managed by Supervisord, creating a daemonized service that runs continuously on Linux and automatically restarts if crashed, providing robust and reliable system operation.

projects.title: React Firebase Oauth 2.0
projects.description: The project is a React application that uses Firebase and Google OAuth 2.0 authentication for secure user access to protected resources. It includes custom login and registration forms, and utilizes modern web technologies such as React, JavaScript, and CSS. Integration with third-party libraries and services enhances the overall reliability and robustness of the application.

projects.title: Java Spring Boot
projects.description: The project utilized Java Springboot as the main technology stack for building a web application. Springboot provided a framework for creating RESTful APIs, which were used to handle user requests and data retrieval from a MySQL database. The application also implemented security features such as user authentication and authorization using Spring Security. Overall, Springboot proved to be a reliable and efficient tool for building a scalable web application.

projects.title: Django Kubernetes
projects.description: The project utilized Django as the primary technology stack for building a web application that was deployed on AWS Kubernetes. The application made use of Kubernetes for container orchestration and management, while Django provided a framework for building the RESTful APIs that the application relied on. The system also integrated with various AWS services such as S3 for file storage and RDS for database management. Overall, the use of Django and Kubernetes on AWS proved to be an effective combination for building a scalable and reliable web application.

projects.title: Quantum Algorithms with Java
projects.description: The project involved using Java to implement quantum algorithms for various applications. Java was chosen for its versatility, and the quantum algorithms were implemented using the Qiskit library. The project also utilized various quantum simulators to test the algorithms, including the IBM Quantum Experience platform. Overall, the use of Java proved to be effective in implementing complex quantum algorithms, and the project provided valuable insights into the potential applications of quantum computing.

projects.title: PDF rendering pipeline with Node & Typescript
projects.description: The project involved utilizing NodeJS and TypeScript to dynamically render PDFs based on user input. NodeJS provided a reliable and efficient backend framework for handling data processing and file generation, while TypeScript was used to ensure type safety and code consistency. The project also made use of various PDF generation libraries such as pdfkit and Puppeteer to facilitate PDF rendering. Overall, the use of NodeJS and TypeScript proved to be a robust and effective solution for generating PDFs dynamically.

projects.title: Video Processing Pipeline with Linux Shell
projects.description: The project utilized FFMPEG to process video and audio files through the bash command line interface. FFMPEG was used to perform various tasks such as video encoding and decoding, audio extraction, and conversion between different file formats. The project also utilized shell scripting to automate the processing of large batches of files. Overall, the use of FFMPEG and shell scripting provided a powerful and flexible toolset for processing multimedia files through the command line.

projects.title: AWS CDK Elastic Beanstalk Automation
projects.description: The project utilized AWS CDK to create multiple Cloud Formation stacks for deploying various AWS services. These services included an AWS network, an RDS instance, an Elasticache cluster, an OpenSearch service, and an Elastic Beanstalk instance. AWS CDK allowed for the creation of infrastructure as code, providing a more streamlined and consistent approach to deployment. The project also utilized various AWS tools such as CloudFormation, EC2, and S3 to facilitate the deployment and management of these services. Overall, the use of AWS CDK and related tools proved to be a powerful and effective solution for deploying and managing complex AWS infrastructure.

projects.title: Cross-Chain Django SSO Application
projects.description: The project involves building a cross-chain environment where users can log in to a Django SSO (Single Sign-On) server and access other Django servers connected to the Solana, Ethereum, and Polygon networks. The SSO server is responsible for authentication and authorization, while the other servers are responsible for interacting with their respective networks.

projects.title: Solana NFT
projects.description: The project involved creating a Solana NFT using CandyMachine, a tool that allows creators to mint NFTs on the Solana blockchain, and Rust Programs. Rust was used to write the smart contract that governs the creation, distribution, and sale of the NFTs. The NFTs were stored on the Solana blockchain, making them easily transferable and secure.

projects.title: Ethereum Smart Contract with Solidity & web3
projects.description: The project involved developing a smart contract on the Ethereum network using Solidity programming language. The contract was designed to facilitate a decentralized voting system that could be implemented across various organizations. The contract was created to ensure transparency and security in the voting process while also reducing the potential for fraud. Additionally, the project involved testing the smart contract using the Remix IDE and deploying it to the Ethereum network using tools like Ganache and Truffle. The smart contract was deployed on a private network and was also tested using the Ropsten test network. Overall, the project aimed to demonstrate the potential of smart contracts for creating decentralized applications on the Ethereum network.

projects.title: Financial Statements with Flask, Redis & CICD
projects.description: The project involves developing a web application for financial reporting using Flask framework. Redis is used for caching to optimize performance. The project also includes CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) to automate the deployment process. The application allows users to upload financial reports in various formats and generates a consolidated report with useful insights and visualizations. The system also supports user authentication and role-based access control to ensure data privacy and security. Overall, the project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for financial analysis and reporting with enhanced performance and security features.

projects.title: Graph Link Prediction using Keras
projects.description: The project utilizes Keras and Deep Learning to perform link prediction in a heterogenous information network, enabling accurate predictions between entities of different types.

projects.title: Record Linkage Algorithm
projects.description: The project leverages Deep Learning algorithms to perform Record Linkage, or entity matching, by comparing and matching data from separate datasources. By utilizing Deep Learning, the project can accurately identify and link similar entities, streamlining data integration and reducing errors.

projects.title: Video Processing with Python
projects.description: The program uses MoviePy to manipulate video files, OpenCV2 to perform image processing, and NumPy to manipulate arrays of video data. The project involves complex algorithms for transforming video frames, including blending, resizing, and overlaying videos. The movie generator is highly customizable, allowing users to adjust settings such as the video duration, frame rate, and output format.

projects.title: HTML Vectorization for Deep Learning
projects.description: The project involved developing an algorithm to convert HTML documents into vectorized objects suitable for use with neural networks. The algorithm used a combination of techniques, including HTML parsing, natural language processing, and dimensionality reduction. The resulting vectors could then be used as inputs for machine learning models to perform tasks such as document classification or information retrieval. The implementation was done in Python, using libraries such as BeautifulSoup and Scikit-learn. The project required significant preprocessing and data cleaning to ensure accurate and meaningful representation of the input HTML documents.

projects.title: Web Crawler with Python
projects.description: The project involved using Python and the asyncio library to create a web crawler that could efficiently scrape and process data from multiple websites simultaneously. The crawler was designed to handle large volumes of data by using asyncio's event loop to manage concurrent requests and minimize blocking I/O operations. The project also made use of other Python libraries such as requests, BeautifulSoup, and pandas to extract, process, and analyze the scraped data. The resulting data was then stored in a local database or exported to a file for further analysis or visualization. Overall, the project demonstrated the power and flexibility of asyncio for handling complex web crawling tasks in a scalable and efficient manner.

projects.title: Statistical Distributions using SciPy
projects.description: This project aims to utilize the powerful scipy library to perform statistical analysis on various distributions and identify the ones that best fit a given dataset. The project will involve analyzing and visualizing the results to gain insights into the underlying distribution of the data.

projects.title: Statistical Estimators
projects.description: This project involves using various statistical estimators to analyze a given dataset. The project aims to identify key metrics and trends within the data, and use them to make informed decisions. The analysis may involve using descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, or regression analysis, depending on the specific research question.

projects.title: Document Classification with Keras
projects.description: The project involved building a document classifier using a neural network implemented with Keras. Data was scraped using the Newspaper3k library and the Google Search API to obtain a corpus of articles related to the topic. The articles were preprocessed using spaCy for POS tagging and lemmatization. The model was trained on this data and evaluated using various performance metrics. AsyncIO and aiohttp were used for asynchronous data retrieval and web scraping, respectively.

projects.title: Image Detection with Keras
projects.description: The project involved building a model for text classification by first conducting topic modeling using the Natural Language Toolkit (nltk) in Python. After identifying the most relevant topics, a neural network was implemented using the Keras library to classify text into those topics. The text was preprocessed using SpaCy for part-of-speech tagging and lemmatization. The accuracy of the model was visualized using Matplotlib. The project also included a comparative analysis of the performance of the neural network model against other classification models.

projects.title: Topic Modeling with NLTK
projects.description:
Implementation of a Neural Network to classify text with Python and Keras
Python Keras NLP Neural Networks Text Classification Topic Modeling Matplotlib SpaCy POS tagging Lemmatization

projects.title: Chat Server with Redis, Celery, MongoDB & Flask
projects.description: Certainly! This project involved the implementation of a chat server using Redis, Celery, MongoDB, and Flask. Redis was used for message queueing and socket management, while Celery was used for asynchronous task processing. MongoDB was used to store user information and chat history, and Flask was used to provide the web interface. The project also involved implementing a RESTful API for mobile client communication. The team used Git for version control and continuous integration for deployment. Overall, the project required a strong understanding of both front-end and back-end technologies, as well as experience with Redis, Celery, MongoDB, and Flask.

projects.title: Geo Analytics with Pandas
projects.description: The project involved analyzing geolocation data using Pandas in Python. The data was obtained from GPS devices and contained latitude, longitude, and timestamps. The objective was to identify patterns and trends in the data to gain insights into the behavior of individuals and groups. Data cleaning techniques were applied to remove outliers and missing values. The cleaned data was then grouped and aggregated to calculate metrics such as distance traveled, speed, and duration. Visualization techniques such as heat maps and scatter plots were used to represent the data visually. The insights gained from the analysis were used to make informed decisions about resource allocation and to improve operational efficiency.

projects.title: Genetic Algorithms with Python
projects.description: The project involved the implementation of a high-performance genetic optimization algorithm using Python. The algorithm utilized techniques such as mutation, crossover, and selection to evolve and optimize a population of candidate solutions towards a defined objective function. The project also made use of various Python libraries such as NumPy and Pandas to facilitate efficient data processing and manipulation. Additionally, the project utilized parallel processing techniques such as multiprocessing and multithreading to improve the algorithm's performance. Overall, the use of Python and related libraries proved to be an effective and efficient solution for implementing the genetic optimization algorithm.

projects.title: Django CMS
projects.description: This project is a Content Management System (CMS) built using the Django web framework. The CMS will enable users to create, edit, and publish digital content, such as articles, blog posts, and multimedia files, using an intuitive web-based interface. The CMS will also include features such as user authentication, content versioning, and search functionality.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Frontend Wizard
receivedRecommendations.givenAt: January 20, 2024, Pablo E. worked with Martin Alejandro on the same team
receivedRecommendations.description:
I have had the pleasure of working with Martin Castro Alvarez in two different companies, and I am pleased to recommend him as an outstanding professional and an exceptional human being.

Martin is an invaluable asset to any team, bringing with him a unique blend of technical expertise, dedication, and interpersonal skills. His proficiency in designing efficient and scalable solutions has been evident in the successful execution of complex projects. His strategic approach to problem-solving reflects a keen understanding of computational complexities and a commitment to delivering optimized solutions.

Martin consistently goes above and beyond to support his colleagues, making him a reliable and trusted member of any project or team. He is approachable, empathetic, and always willing to lend a helping hand. His positive attitude and genuine concern for the well-being of those around him make him not just a colleague but a friend.

I wholeheartedly recommend Martin Castro Alvarez for any professional endeavor. His commitment to excellence, coupled with his outstanding interpersonal skills, makes him an asset to any organization. I am confident that he will continue to excel in all his future endeavors, and I feel fortunate to have had the opportunity to work alongside such a remarkable individual.

If you have any further questions or would like more details, please feel free to contact me.

receivedRecommendations.description: I have worked with Martin for 3 years in Ampush. He led one of the most complex integrations we did at Ampush, building a payments solution, integrating with 4 third party APIs, using a micro services architecture in python on AWS. He is extremely skilled in python, has great ownership of projects that he works on and is always polite no matter what the situation. He is a very good team player, always willing to help and goes the extra mile to help people out and to make sure the project is delivered on time and with high quality. He has a very high quality bar for himself. Great communication skills and great attitude. I would hire him again any time.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Business System Analyst at Plus54

We've worked together on several projects and he has willingly helped me on several of mine when I needed. He's a supportive friend, a valuable team member and an excelent worker always striving to learn beyond the actual business in order to expand his skilss, kowledge and put it at the service of the company he is working for, his collegues and his work. I would definitely recommend Martin for any job as he is a fast and earnest learner.

experience.description:
I designed and implemented advanced blockchain solutions by integrating Django applications with Solidity and Rust smart contracts, significantly enhancing both functionality and performance. I worked closely with account managers to successfully deploy digital drops, phygital products, and NFTs, utilizing a range of technologies including web3.js, ethers.js, Alchemy, Moralis, Ethereum, Etherscan, IPFS, Solidity, MetaMask, Coinbase, Wallet Connect, Solscan, and Royalty Registry.

I tackled complex troubleshooting tasks involving Ethereum transactions, blockchain events, failed media uploads, corrupted IPFS metadata, and issues related to account balances and gas payments. This role utilized Python, Django, Celery, unit testing, and Airflow to develop robust solutions.

I developed and maintained an MLOps pipeline to support scalable machine learning operations in the cloud, ensuring robust deployment and management of ML models. This involved tools like AWS SageMaker, TensorFlow, gRPC, Docker, and Kubernetes to facilitate operations.

I led the design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines, managed AWS configurations via AWS CDK, and spearheaded the dockerization of applications. I ensured the security and maintenance of environments across multiple AWS services, including Elastic Beanstalk, ECR, RDS, Opensearch, Elasticache, S3, Cloudfront, and DMS.

I orchestrated the deployment of GCP BigQuery, managing data migration and facilitating real-time data ingestion. My responsibilities included leveraging GCP Data Fusion and GCP Data Streams to enhance data integration and analytics capabilities.

As part of the premium solutions team, I designed and executed bespoke solutions tailored to partner needs, working alongside account managers to implement digital drops and phygital NFTs. My role also included writing and maintaining Cypress, unit, integration, and functional tests to ensure high-quality web pages and prevent regressions.

I engineered a distributed graph algorithm in Spark for real-time shortest path queries, enhancing data materialization and accessibility using technologies such as AWS Glue, Data Lake, and AWS SQS for robust data management and modeling.

I led the design of a serverless AWS backend, applying modern principles to ensure efficient distribution and scalability, utilizing AWS Lambda, AWS SQS, AWS SNS, AWS DynamoDB, AWS Elasticsearch, and Kibana.

I spearheaded the creation of reporting datasets using AWS Redshift, Athena, and Glue, streamlining our data warehousing approach with tools like AWS S3, PySpark, and AWS Lambda to enhance business intelligence.

I executed a secure, cost-efficient networking architecture, focusing on data integrity and reducing transfer costs with AWS VPC, AWS Subnets, AWS Routing Tables, AWS IGW, and AWS NAT Gateway.

I ensured stringent data privacy, traceability, security, compliance, authentication, and role-based authorization using AWS Cognito, AWS Lambda, Google Oauth, and comprehensive audit logs.

I constructed microservices and a web interface using GraphQL on AWS AppSync and Lambda, ensuring seamless functionality, complemented by Node, JavaScript, React, and TypeScript.

I elevated unit test coverage to 95%, managing functional, regression testing, automation, and the CI/CD pipeline, incorporating practices like TDD and tools such as Stress Tests.

I collaborated using Agile methodologies to deliver projects efficiently and on time, optimizing our process through Scrum, Sprint Planning, Jira, and Confluence.

I integrated external datasets using an advanced multi-source matching algorithm to enhance data synergy, leveraging AWS Glue Find Matches, and distributed lookup tables for probabilistic and deterministic matching.

I implemented a content delivery network, caching policy, and security roles through AWS Lambda@Edge, AWS S3, and AWS CloudFront to ensure efficient content delivery and security.

I established a distributed data pipeline on AWS to enhance efficient data processing and transfer, leveraging Python, AWS Lambda, AWS Cloud Watch, AWS SQS, AWS SNS, AWS API Gateway, AWS SES, AWS Batch, Dashbird, Docker, AuroraDB, AWS RDS, AWS Cloud Front, and integrating unit tests, CI/CD pipelines, and Slack API for comprehensive monitoring and communication.

I created an NLP framework to crawl and transform HTML into structured business entities, ensuring seamless integration. This involved using technologies such as Web Crawling, SpaCy, Keras, OpenCV, Airtable, NetworkX, nltk, JellyFish, Gensim, NER, Regular Expressions, AWS Comprehend, AWS Rekognition, and Snowflake for robust data analysis and processing.

I designed and built a marketplace frontend with React, Redux, Saga, and integrated Stripe Connect for a seamless user experience. The project utilized Node, JavaScript, ReactJS, react-redux, react-saga, axios, AWS Amplify, StripeJS, Firebase Push Notifications, and Firebase Authentication to create a highly interactive and secure platform.

I enhanced our data pipeline by profiling code with cProfile, migrating Python to Cython, and employing asyncio for optimization, incorporating technologies like CPython, C, C++, ctypes, Python.h, Cython, setup.py, FFMPEG, aiohttp, and aiofiles to improve performance and efficiency.

I developed a distributed recommender system on AWS Serverless architecture to provide efficient recommendations, utilizing Search Indexing, Content Ranking, Algolia, Collaborative Filtering, NumPy, and Matplotlib.

I wrote Cypress tests to ensure the application's functionality post-deployment and implemented CloudWatch alerts to monitor serverless application performance. Additionally, I conducted Data Quality Acceptance tests to prevent data drift or model drift, ensuring that our models maintained high prediction quality over time.

experience.location: Bahía de San Francisco y alrededores, Estados Unidos
experience.description:
At Ampush, I contributed to server-side user tracking, A/B testing, and backend reporting tools on AWS, using Python, Flask, REST APIs, OpenPyXL, and boto3 for robust data handling.

I collaborated using Agile methods with a global team, employing Sprints, Scrum, Kanban, JIRA, and Confluence, focusing on efficient project execution through pull requests and code reviews.

I developed business analytics APIs with Flask on AWS platforms like EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, Route 53, DynamoDB, RDS, S3, Lambda, and SES for enhanced data access.

I worked with senior engineers to transition our backend to a fault-tolerant microservices architecture using AWS ECS, SQS, SNS, Docker, and HashCorp Consul, emphasizing principles such as eventual consistency and fault tolerance.

I managed various databases including PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, and Apache Cassandra, integrating AWS RDS and DBT for flexible data management.

I improved unit and functional test coverage in a microservices environment, utilizing CircleCI, Rollbar, Sentry, Splunk, and AWS CloudWatch for detailed monitoring and quality assurance.

I collaborated with business teams to boost customer lifetime value metrics, using SQL and APIs from Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Facebook Marketing, and other platforms, supplemented by analytics tools like Tableau and Knowi.

I designed a microservices payments application integrating Stripe and Shopify, focusing on secure online transactions, compliance, and subscription management.

I implemented rigorous testing, including unit, BDD, load, and longevity tests, to ensure the application’s functionality and scalability post-deployment, supported by CircleCI, Rollbar, Sentry, and AWS CloudWatch.

experience.position: Certified IBM IT specialist - American Express - Banco Santander Rio - ICBC
experience.description:
I provided UNIX and networking support to major financial institutions like American Express, Banco Santander Rio, and ICBC, utilizing Red Hat Enterprise Linux, IBM AIX, SuSE Linux Enterprise Server, Oracle Solaris, systemd, and various shell scripting and virtualization technologies such as Bash, Korn Shell, Oracle Virtual Box, and KVM.

During 2014, I supported American Express in a successful datacenter migration, ensuring uninterrupted operations through effective troubleshooting, incident and change management, patch automation, and disaster recovery processes using tools like Service Now, Manage Now, BMC Remedy, and WebSphere Application Server.

I contributed to the deployment, setup, and troubleshooting of network services ensuring seamless operations. This involved configuring and managing DHCP, DNS, SSO, LDAP servers, and network tools like netstat, traceroute, nmap, ssh, telnet, and ping.

I engaged in provisioning virtual storage devices within SAN environments to streamline storage management, using technologies like EMC SAN, EMC NAS, IBM GPFS, Veritas Volume Manager, and Linux Volume Manager.

Developed and maintained server automation scripts using Python, Perl, and Shell scripting for infrastructure management. Created ETL jobs and automated deployment processes to streamline operations for enterprise banking clients.

Built internal LAMP web applications and tools using Java Spring Boot, PHP, and Django. Implemented modular components with design patterns, created responsive frontends with HTML, CSS, jQuery, and Bootstrap for enterprise dashboards.

I installed, patched, and maintained Unix server-based database services to ensure reliable database management across platforms such as Oracle Database, IBM DB2, MySQL, and MongoDB.

I managed thousands of servers using automation and remote administration tools, focusing on quality assurance, monitoring metrics, and setting up alerts to maintain service quality.

projects.title: AWS Local Stack Partitioned Stream Processing
projects.description: This project implements a scalable, event-driven architecture for secure transaction signing using AWS LocalStack for local emulation. It ingests high-throughput unstructured data into Kinesis, persists raw inputs to S3 for replay, and routes records through an intermediate batching stream that triggers a Lambda function. The Lambda retrieves RSA private key ARNs from Aurora Serverless, signs the batched data, and stores signed payloads in a separate S3 bucket. It is built with CDK and Docker Compose, the system ensures reliable, exactly-once processing with optimized Lambda performance and modular RSA key management via AWS Secrets Manager.

projects.title: OpenGL 3D Modeling
projects.description:
This project demonstrates advanced OpenGL rendering techniques by implementing a real-time 3D scene with multiple camera perspectives.

It features three distinct geometric objects (a cube, a pyramid, and a prism) rendered with Phong-Blinn lighting and dynamic shading. The application showcases both a primary and a secondary camera, with the secondary camera's view displayed as a floating minimap overlay within the main window. The project includes custom framebuffer management, real-time object animation, and interactive window resizing, all built using modern OpenGL (Core Profile 3.3), GLFW, GLEW, and GLM for matrix and vector operations. This work highlights skills in C++, graphics programming, shader development, and real-time rendering pipeline management.

projects.title: React LLM
projects.description:
This project is a React-based single page application, styled using TailwindCSS, that allows users to explore and analyze character interactions in Project Gutenberg e-books. The application leverages a Language Learning Model (LLM) to process the text of e-books and visually represent character interactions through an interactive network graph.

The application is deployed on AWS using the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK), which automates the setup of AWS Lambda for backend processing and API Gateway for handling requests efficiently. This deployment strategy was chosen to take advantage of AWS's free tier, making it cost-effective and scalable.

projects.title: SQL Code Editor AI Agent
projects.description: This project is a tool that helps you create SQL queries using AI technology. It has a web interface that works like Cursor, making it easy to use. The system uses two different AI agents that work together: One agent talks with you to understand what you need. Another agent creates the actual SQL code.

projects.title: Dockerized Rust API using Tokio, Warp, Alloy, Foundry, and Grafana.
projects.description: This project is a Dockerized Rust API that leverages Tokio, Warp, Alloy, Foundry, and Grafana to interact with Ethereum nodes, providing balance queries and real-time monitoring. It integrates Anvil for local Ethereum development, OpenTelemetry for tracing, and Prometheus + Grafana for monitoring, making it a robust solution for blockchain-based applications. The API is built with Warp for high-performance async HTTP handling and supports structured logging, CORS, and OpenTelemetry tracing. With a simple Docker Compose setup, it allows seamless deployment and local development, ensuring a production-ready Ethereum API environment. 🚀🔗 #RustLang #Blockchain #Ethereum #Web3 #Observability.

projects.title: Risc Zero Rust app
projects.description: This project demonstrates a zero-knowledge proof system using RiscZero's zkVM. It compiles a guest program located in the ./methods/guest directory into an ELF binary, which is then executed by a host Rust application that also runs a Warp server. The server exposes endpoints to remotely trigger zkVM executions, allowing users to submit inputs, obtain the computed result along with a cryptographic proof of execution, and ultimately validate that proof on-chain. The entire process—from building the guest ELF to running the host server—is containerized using Docker, ensuring a reproducible and isolated environment for development and deployment.

projects.title: Upgradeable Solidity contract with access management.
projects.description: This project is a Solidity-based upgradeable smart contract system leveraging OpenZeppelin's upgradeable libraries to provide secure and flexible access control, signature verification, and contract management. It includes a Manager contract that handles role-based access control, pausability, upgradeability with state migration, and integration with an external Verifier contract for validating user signatures. Built with Foundry for testing and deployment, the system ensures security through strict role enforcement, robust error handling, and seamless upgrade mechanisms.

projects.title: Zero-Knowledge Contract Trust Mechanism
projects.description: This project, titled zk-trust, leverages Zero-Knowledge Proofs to enhance security in the DeFi ecosystem by verifying the attributes of ERC20 tokens before they are listed on platforms. By implementing a robust validation mechanism off-chain and confirming the authenticity on-chain via a Solidity smart contract, this system helps prevent fraud similar to the recent Ionic Money Hack, ensuring only legitimate tokens are used within the platform. Check out the full demonstration on GitHub to see how this innovative approach can safeguard investments and maintain trust in DeFi transactions.

projects.title: Ethereum local development with Anvil
projects.description: This project involved the development of an Ethereum-based application using the Web3.js library, which provided an engaging platform to interact with the blockchain. My role encompassed setting up a local development environment using Anvil, crafting scripts for sending transactions, and managing wallet balances. I successfully implemented functionality to handle cryptocurrency transactions dynamically by connecting to and interacting with a simulated Ethereum network. This experience enhanced my understanding of blockchain technology, Ethereum smart contracts, and the intricacies of transaction fee mechanisms, making it a valuable addition to my portfolio of cutting-edge technological competencies.

projects.title: AWS SageMaker CDK
projects.description: This project automates the deployment and management of multiple machine learning models using AWS services like SageMaker, Lambda, API Gateway, and EventBridge, ensuring seamless integration and scalable real-time inference.

projects.title: GCP Kubernetes
projects.description: This project involved setting up a Kubernetes cluster on Google Cloud Platform using Google Cloud Deployment Manager, automating the creation and management of GCP resources. I developed YAML and Jinja templates to efficiently deploy a multi-node Kubernetes cluster, enhancing scalability and availability. This initiative not only streamlined operations but also bolstered my expertise in cloud infrastructure and containerized environments, improving our team's development workflows.

projects.title: Visual Transformer (ViT) Classifier
projects.description: This project involves developing a deep learning model for classifying different types of apparel from images, such as T-shirts, trousers, pullovers, dresses, and more. Using a pre-trained Vision Transformer (ViT) as the base model, the project enhances it with additional layers to improve classification accuracy. The model is trained with techniques like data augmentation, batch normalization, and dropout to reduce overfitting and enhance performance. The training process includes handling class imbalances by sampling more instances of underrepresented classes, and the optimizer is fine-tuned to focus on these new layers. The goal is to create an accurate and robust model that can reliably identify various apparel categories in real-world applications.

projects.title: Hexagonal Architecture Spring Boot
projects.description: The projec utilizes Hexagonal Architecture in Java Spring Boot for e-commerce management with a React and Tailwind frontend. It features domain models, service interfaces, and custom exceptions to streamline operations, supported by comprehensive unit tests. Key functionalities, including user and product management, are demonstrated in interactive demos. The architecture promotes modularity and ease of maintenance, ensuring adaptability and scalability through well-defined web and database API adapters.

projects.title: LangChain Assistant
projects.description: This project represents a cutting-edge integration of LangChain and Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance the processing and comprehension of web search results, aiming to refine and reconstruct truncated information for improved clarity and user engagement. By leveraging advanced NLP techniques and custom tool development, we have successfully created an intelligent agent capable of consulting previous messages, conducting web searches, and presenting human-readable summaries without the common ellipsis truncation. This initiative not only showcases our commitment to innovation in AI-driven content refinement but also sets a new benchmark in the development of conversational agents, contributing significantly to the field of AI and offering tangible benefits to startups navigating the complexities of compliance in California.

projects.title: PySpark Docker
projects.description: This GitHub project demonstrates the innovative integration of PySpark within Docker containers, illustrating a scalable and efficient approach to processing large datasets in distributed computing environments. By leveraging Docker's virtualization capabilities alongside PySpark's powerful data processing engine, the project offers a blueprint for building and deploying scalable data analytics applications. It showcases how to encapsulate PySpark applications in Docker, ensuring consistency, portability, and ease of deployment across different environments.

projects.title: Cypress Tests
projects.description: This project showcases the integration of Cypress tests within a web development environment, emphasizing the crucial role of automated testing in building robust, error-free applications. By leveraging Cypress, an advanced end-to-end testing framework, the project aims to demonstrate best practices in test automation for both small and large-scale web projects.

projects.title: Microfrontends
projects.description: The project is centered on implementing a distributed frontend architecture for medium and large companies. It aims to enhance scalability and maintainability in web development by modularizing the frontend, thus facilitating smoother collaboration and more agile processes in complex, large-scale applications.

projects.title: AWS Django Ansible
projects.description: The project utilizes Ansible in a Docker container to implement a Django application. It provides flexibility by connecting to AWS EC2 instances, allowing seamless deployment and management of the application in both local and cloud environments.

projects.title: AWS Django Terraform
projects.description: The project aims to automate the deployment of a Django application using Terraform. It provisions an EC2 instance in a public subnet, installs necessary dependencies, and runs the application using Gunicorn.

projects.title: Apache Hive
projects.description: The project involved implementing a Hive server using Docker Compose, which reads and writes data to HDFS. The project also included using the Hive CLI, web interface, and Python PyHive library to interact with the Hive server. The goal was to demonstrate the versatility and ease of use of Hive and Docker Compose in setting up and managing a data processing pipeline with HDFS.

projects.title: Apache Kafka Project
projects.description: This project leverages Docker Compose to run an Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster, along with YARN and ZooKeeper, as well as Kafka. Python is used as both the producer and consumer to send and consume data into a Kafka topic, enabling distributed data processing and storage using a familiar language and ecosystem.

projects.title: Django Geospatial Data
projects.description: The project is a geospatial application that leverages GeoDjango and PostGIS to create and manage multiple points, lines, and polygons. It calculates distances between these objects and performs various operations using them to support geospatial analysis and visualization.

projects.title: Flexbox Project
projects.description: The project is a web development endeavor aimed at implementing flexbox, a powerful layout system used in modern CSS, with a focus on creating flexible and responsive designs. Through this project, developers will gain an understanding of the different properties and techniques that can be utilized to achieve custom layouts for their web pages. By leveraging flexbox, users will be able to create dynamic and adaptive interfaces that adjust to the size and orientation of various devices. This project aims to equip developers with the skills and knowledge necessary to create intuitive and visually appealing web layouts that can easily adapt to changing needs and trends.

projects.title: Hadoop Map Reduce
projects.description: The project involved setting up a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) using Docker and Docker Compose, followed by submitting a MapReduce job to the cluster. The web interface of the History Server was used to monitor the progress of the job.

projects.title: GPT Context Injection
projects.description: The project focuses on leveraging the powerful combination of the GPT API, Elasticsearch, and SpaCy to implement a specialized chatbot capable of context injection. The chatbot's primary objective is to ingest and analyze data from a specific WordPress blog, providing relevant and contextual responses to user queries.

projects.title: HBase Project
projects.description: The project is a Docker-based solution for storing unstructured data in HBase with HDFS as the underlying storage system. It includes a Python client for easy data storage and retrieval, making it an ideal solution for managing large volumes of data.

projects.title: Python Supervisord
projects.description: The project is a Python script managed by Supervisord, creating a daemonized service that runs continuously on Linux and automatically restarts if crashed, providing robust and reliable system operation.

projects.title: React Firebase Oauth 2.0
projects.description: The project is a React application that uses Firebase and Google OAuth 2.0 authentication for secure user access to protected resources. It includes custom login and registration forms, and utilizes modern web technologies such as React, JavaScript, and CSS. Integration with third-party libraries and services enhances the overall reliability and robustness of the application.

projects.title: Java Spring Boot
projects.description: The project utilized Java Springboot as the main technology stack for building a web application. Springboot provided a framework for creating RESTful APIs, which were used to handle user requests and data retrieval from a MySQL database. The application also implemented security features such as user authentication and authorization using Spring Security. Overall, Springboot proved to be a reliable and efficient tool for building a scalable web application.

projects.title: Django Kubernetes
projects.description: The project utilized Django as the primary technology stack for building a web application that was deployed on AWS Kubernetes. The application made use of Kubernetes for container orchestration and management, while Django provided a framework for building the RESTful APIs that the application relied on. The system also integrated with various AWS services such as S3 for file storage and RDS for database management. Overall, the use of Django and Kubernetes on AWS proved to be an effective combination for building a scalable and reliable web application.

projects.title: Quantum Algorithms with Java
projects.description: The project involved using Java to implement quantum algorithms for various applications. Java was chosen for its versatility, and the quantum algorithms were implemented using the Qiskit library. The project also utilized various quantum simulators to test the algorithms, including the IBM Quantum Experience platform. Overall, the use of Java proved to be effective in implementing complex quantum algorithms, and the project provided valuable insights into the potential applications of quantum computing.

projects.title: PDF rendering pipeline with Node & Typescript
projects.description: The project involved utilizing NodeJS and TypeScript to dynamically render PDFs based on user input. NodeJS provided a reliable and efficient backend framework for handling data processing and file generation, while TypeScript was used to ensure type safety and code consistency. The project also made use of various PDF generation libraries such as pdfkit and Puppeteer to facilitate PDF rendering. Overall, the use of NodeJS and TypeScript proved to be a robust and effective solution for generating PDFs dynamically.

projects.title: Video Processing Pipeline with Linux Shell
projects.description: The project utilized FFMPEG to process video and audio files through the bash command line interface. FFMPEG was used to perform various tasks such as video encoding and decoding, audio extraction, and conversion between different file formats. The project also utilized shell scripting to automate the processing of large batches of files. Overall, the use of FFMPEG and shell scripting provided a powerful and flexible toolset for processing multimedia files through the command line.

projects.title: AWS CDK Elastic Beanstalk Automation
projects.description: The project utilized AWS CDK to create multiple Cloud Formation stacks for deploying various AWS services. These services included an AWS network, an RDS instance, an Elasticache cluster, an OpenSearch service, and an Elastic Beanstalk instance. AWS CDK allowed for the creation of infrastructure as code, providing a more streamlined and consistent approach to deployment. The project also utilized various AWS tools such as CloudFormation, EC2, and S3 to facilitate the deployment and management of these services. Overall, the use of AWS CDK and related tools proved to be a powerful and effective solution for deploying and managing complex AWS infrastructure.

projects.title: Cross-Chain Django SSO Application
projects.description: The project involves building a cross-chain environment where users can log in to a Django SSO (Single Sign-On) server and access other Django servers connected to the Solana, Ethereum, and Polygon networks. The SSO server is responsible for authentication and authorization, while the other servers are responsible for interacting with their respective networks.

projects.title: Solana NFT
projects.description: The project involved creating a Solana NFT using CandyMachine, a tool that allows creators to mint NFTs on the Solana blockchain, and Rust Programs. Rust was used to write the smart contract that governs the creation, distribution, and sale of the NFTs. The NFTs were stored on the Solana blockchain, making them easily transferable and secure.

projects.title: Ethereum Smart Contract with Solidity & web3
projects.description: The project involved developing a smart contract on the Ethereum network using Solidity programming language. The contract was designed to facilitate a decentralized voting system that could be implemented across various organizations. The contract was created to ensure transparency and security in the voting process while also reducing the potential for fraud. Additionally, the project involved testing the smart contract using the Remix IDE and deploying it to the Ethereum network using tools like Ganache and Truffle. The smart contract was deployed on a private network and was also tested using the Ropsten test network. Overall, the project aimed to demonstrate the potential of smart contracts for creating decentralized applications on the Ethereum network.

projects.title: Financial Statements with Flask, Redis & CICD
projects.description: The project involves developing a web application for financial reporting using Flask framework. Redis is used for caching to optimize performance. The project also includes CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) to automate the deployment process. The application allows users to upload financial reports in various formats and generates a consolidated report with useful insights and visualizations. The system also supports user authentication and role-based access control to ensure data privacy and security. Overall, the project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for financial analysis and reporting with enhanced performance and security features.

projects.title: Graph Link Prediction using Keras
projects.description: The project utilizes Keras and Deep Learning to perform link prediction in a heterogenous information network, enabling accurate predictions between entities of different types.

projects.title: Record Linkage Algorithm
projects.description: The project leverages Deep Learning algorithms to perform Record Linkage, or entity matching, by comparing and matching data from separate datasources. By utilizing Deep Learning, the project can accurately identify and link similar entities, streamlining data integration and reducing errors.

projects.title: Video Processing with Python
projects.description: The program uses MoviePy to manipulate video files, OpenCV2 to perform image processing, and NumPy to manipulate arrays of video data. The project involves complex algorithms for transforming video frames, including blending, resizing, and overlaying videos. The movie generator is highly customizable, allowing users to adjust settings such as the video duration, frame rate, and output format.

projects.title: HTML Vectorization for Deep Learning
projects.description: The project involved developing an algorithm to convert HTML documents into vectorized objects suitable for use with neural networks. The algorithm used a combination of techniques, including HTML parsing, natural language processing, and dimensionality reduction. The resulting vectors could then be used as inputs for machine learning models to perform tasks such as document classification or information retrieval. The implementation was done in Python, using libraries such as BeautifulSoup and Scikit-learn. The project required significant preprocessing and data cleaning to ensure accurate and meaningful representation of the input HTML documents.

projects.title: Web Crawler with Python
projects.description: The project involved using Python and the asyncio library to create a web crawler that could efficiently scrape and process data from multiple websites simultaneously. The crawler was designed to handle large volumes of data by using asyncio's event loop to manage concurrent requests and minimize blocking I/O operations. The project also made use of other Python libraries such as requests, BeautifulSoup, and pandas to extract, process, and analyze the scraped data. The resulting data was then stored in a local database or exported to a file for further analysis or visualization. Overall, the project demonstrated the power and flexibility of asyncio for handling complex web crawling tasks in a scalable and efficient manner.

projects.title: Statistical Distributions using SciPy
projects.description: This project aims to utilize the powerful scipy library to perform statistical analysis on various distributions and identify the ones that best fit a given dataset. The project will involve analyzing and visualizing the results to gain insights into the underlying distribution of the data.

projects.title: Statistical Estimators
projects.description: This project involves using various statistical estimators to analyze a given dataset. The project aims to identify key metrics and trends within the data, and use them to make informed decisions. The analysis may involve using descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, or regression analysis, depending on the specific research question.

projects.title: Document Classification with Keras
projects.description: The project involved building a document classifier using a neural network implemented with Keras. Data was scraped using the Newspaper3k library and the Google Search API to obtain a corpus of articles related to the topic. The articles were preprocessed using spaCy for POS tagging and lemmatization. The model was trained on this data and evaluated using various performance metrics. AsyncIO and aiohttp were used for asynchronous data retrieval and web scraping, respectively.

projects.title: Image Detection with Keras
projects.description: The project involved building a model for text classification by first conducting topic modeling using the Natural Language Toolkit (nltk) in Python. After identifying the most relevant topics, a neural network was implemented using the Keras library to classify text into those topics. The text was preprocessed using SpaCy for part-of-speech tagging and lemmatization. The accuracy of the model was visualized using Matplotlib. The project also included a comparative analysis of the performance of the neural network model against other classification models.

projects.title: Topic Modeling with NLTK
projects.description:
Implementation of a Neural Network to classify text with Python and Keras
Python Keras NLP Neural Networks Text Classification Topic Modeling Matplotlib SpaCy POS tagging Lemmatization

projects.title: Chat Server with Redis, Celery, MongoDB & Flask
projects.description: Certainly! This project involved the implementation of a chat server using Redis, Celery, MongoDB, and Flask. Redis was used for message queueing and socket management, while Celery was used for asynchronous task processing. MongoDB was used to store user information and chat history, and Flask was used to provide the web interface. The project also involved implementing a RESTful API for mobile client communication. The team used Git for version control and continuous integration for deployment. Overall, the project required a strong understanding of both front-end and back-end technologies, as well as experience with Redis, Celery, MongoDB, and Flask.

projects.title: Geo Analytics with Pandas
projects.description: The project involved analyzing geolocation data using Pandas in Python. The data was obtained from GPS devices and contained latitude, longitude, and timestamps. The objective was to identify patterns and trends in the data to gain insights into the behavior of individuals and groups. Data cleaning techniques were applied to remove outliers and missing values. The cleaned data was then grouped and aggregated to calculate metrics such as distance traveled, speed, and duration. Visualization techniques such as heat maps and scatter plots were used to represent the data visually. The insights gained from the analysis were used to make informed decisions about resource allocation and to improve operational efficiency.

projects.title: Genetic Algorithms with Python
projects.description: The project involved the implementation of a high-performance genetic optimization algorithm using Python. The algorithm utilized techniques such as mutation, crossover, and selection to evolve and optimize a population of candidate solutions towards a defined objective function. The project also made use of various Python libraries such as NumPy and Pandas to facilitate efficient data processing and manipulation. Additionally, the project utilized parallel processing techniques such as multiprocessing and multithreading to improve the algorithm's performance. Overall, the use of Python and related libraries proved to be an effective and efficient solution for implementing the genetic optimization algorithm.

projects.title: Django CMS
projects.description: This project is a Content Management System (CMS) built using the Django web framework. The CMS will enable users to create, edit, and publish digital content, such as articles, blog posts, and multimedia files, using an intuitive web-based interface. The CMS will also include features such as user authentication, content versioning, and search functionality.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Frontend Wizard
receivedRecommendations.givenAt: January 20, 2024, Pablo E. worked with Martin Alejandro on the same team
receivedRecommendations.description:
I have had the pleasure of working with Martin Castro Alvarez in two different companies, and I am pleased to recommend him as an outstanding professional and an exceptional human being.

Martin is an invaluable asset to any team, bringing with him a unique blend of technical expertise, dedication, and interpersonal skills. His proficiency in designing efficient and scalable solutions has been evident in the successful execution of complex projects. His strategic approach to problem-solving reflects a keen understanding of computational complexities and a commitment to delivering optimized solutions.

Martin consistently goes above and beyond to support his colleagues, making him a reliable and trusted member of any project or team. He is approachable, empathetic, and always willing to lend a helping hand. His positive attitude and genuine concern for the well-being of those around him make him not just a colleague but a friend.

I wholeheartedly recommend Martin Castro Alvarez for any professional endeavor. His commitment to excellence, coupled with his outstanding interpersonal skills, makes him an asset to any organization. I am confident that he will continue to excel in all his future endeavors, and I feel fortunate to have had the opportunity to work alongside such a remarkable individual.

If you have any further questions or would like more details, please feel free to contact me.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Comunicación y Social Media Euroinnova International Online Education
receivedRecommendations.givenAt: June 29, 2021, Martin Alejandro was Álvaro’s client
receivedRecommendations.description: Martín Alejandro Castro Álvarez ha demostrado muy buenas habilidades y un trabajo ejemplar, obteniendo resultados sobresalientes en el Máster en Estadística Aplicada. Por ello escribimos esta recomendación y le damos la enhorabuena por todos los conocimientos adquiridos y por conseguir todos los objetivos propuestos con excelente calificación.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Head of Technology at SentiLink
receivedRecommendations.givenAt: June 4, 2019, Gautam managed Martin Alejandro directly
receivedRecommendations.description: I have worked with Martin for 3 years in Ampush. He led one of the most complex integrations we did at Ampush, building a payments solution, integrating with 4 third party APIs, using a micro services architecture in python on AWS. He is extremely skilled in python, has great ownership of projects that he works on and is always polite no matter what the situation. He is a very good team player, always willing to help and goes the extra mile to help people out and to make sure the project is delivered on time and with high quality. He has a very high quality bar for himself. Great communication skills and great attitude. I would hire him again any time.

receivedRecommendations.givenByHeadline: Business System Analyst at Plus54
receivedRecommendations.givenAt: October 19, 2013, Matias worked with Martin Alejandro on the same team
receivedRecommendations.description: Martin has been one of the best co-workers I've had. He's professional, efficient, intelligent, capable, responsible and a good team player. We've worked together on several projects and he has willingly helped me on several of mine when I needed. He's a supportive friend, a valuable team member and an excelent worker always striving to learn beyond the actual business in order to expand his skilss, kowledge and put it at the service of the company he is working for, his collegues and his work. I would definitely recommend Martin for any job as he is a fast and earnest learner.

headline: Commercial Director / Senior Sales Manager / Commercial Engineer
about:
Experiencia en el diseño e implementación de nuevas estrategias comerciales, modelos de negocio y gestión de equipos de alto rendimiento. Fuerte orientación a resultados con capacidad de liderazgo en entornos de alta exigencia y presión.

Experiencia Comercial en mercados internacionales: Argentina, México, Brasil, Colombia, entre otros.
topSkills: Liderazgo de equipos multidisciplinarios • Visión estratégica • Gestión comercial • Estrategias de mercado • Gestión de ventas corporativas

experience.description:
Design and execution of commercial strategy and MKT, development of new business units and international partners (Brazil, China). Sales Force Management.
+10 dependents.

Responsible for marketing, sales, and new business. Design, planification, and implementation of Commercial strategies. Sales Force Management.
+15 dependents.
Main Clients: Tagle Group, AKO Agro, Terralon Construction, 21st Century Business University (General Advisor for “Innovation and Development Engineering” and “Transport and Road Engineering”).
Senior Consultant of the New Degree Career, Engineering in Innovation and Development. Senior Consultant of the New Graduate Career, Transport and Road Engineering.

Commercial Management of Holcim Argentina nationwide.

• Design, plan, and implement commercial strategies. EBITDA increased by 30% in one year.
• Sales Force Management (Regional Managers, Commercial Executives, Commercial Analysts).
• Development of new value proposals for customers and end users of the commercial network.
• Addressed the direction of the DISENSA-Red Minetti project - www.disensa.com.
• Project Lead of the "New Pallet Management System" (2015-2016). Project profit of USD 1,5M per month.

+50 dependents.

Marketing and sales management of Holcim’s cements. Design, planification, and execution of commercial strategies and cost control. Sales team management. Achieved goal of increasing the market share by over 15pp in less than 1.5 years.

+20 dependents.
Project lead of the “Affordable Housing” project Argentina.

www.disensa.com / Red Minetti

• Decommoditization of Cement in the Distributors’ Channel. Implementation in +500 stores.
• Design and activation of financial tools, microcredits, commercial and technical assistance, materials, and capital goods purchasing club as well as external image, internal layout, quantification and costing software, material purchase App, and loyalty program.
“Excellence in Channel Management” - “Holcim Commercial Awards 2009”.

+30 dependents.
Project lead of the “Megacities Argentina” project.

Project lead of the “Holcim Value Chain” project
Project direction. Made a comprehensive study of Channel Management for the Argentinean market, Concrete Products, Ready Mix, Aggregates, Asphalt, and Dry Mortar.
“Excellence top 3 Holcim International”

+10 dependents.
Commercial management and development of client portfolio, new business, and technical assistance to end users.
